Executive Summary for the Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal

Water Treatment Plant

Plainview, Texas



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

We at Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant, Plainview, Texas, are strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is inherent to a comprehensive accidental release prevention program in place that covers areas such as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible releases of regulated substances.



2. The Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment PlantA?s primary activities encompass water treatment for the City of Plainview, Texas. We have one regulated substance present at our facility, Chlorine. This regulated substance at our facility is used to treat (disinfect) potable water for our customers.



The maximum inventory of Chlorine at our facility is 4,000 pounds.



3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant has taken all the necessary steps to comply with the accidental release prevention requirements set out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place at our facility.



3.1. Safety Information

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant maintains a detailed record of safety information that includes the management system, major hazards summary, MSDS data sheet, safe upper and lower temperatures, pressures, flows and compositions, equipment specifications, and codes and standards.



3.2. Hazard Review

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant conducts comprehensive studies to ensure that hazards associated with our process

es are identified and controlled efficiently. The methodology used to carry out these analyses is a Hazard Review Checklist for Chlorine. The checklist is undertaken by a team of qualified personnel with expertise in process operations and is revalidated at a regular interval of five years. Any findings related to the hazard analysis are addressed in a timely manner.



3.3. Operating Procedures

For the purposes of safely conducting activities within our covered processes, Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant maintains written operating procedures. These procedures address various modes of operation such as initial startup, normal operations, temporary operations, emergency shutdown, emergency operations, normal shutdown and startup after a shutdown. The information is regularly reviewed and is readily accessible to operators involved in the processes.



3.4. Training

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant has a training program in place to ensure that employees who are operating processes are competent in the operating procedures associated with these processes. Training includes both formal classroom training and one-on-one on the job training. Formal classroom training is provided at short courses to comply with operator certification requirements. All operators review chlorine safety videos annually.



3.5. Management

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant carries out documented maintenance checks on process equipment to ensure proper operations. Process equipment examined by these checks includes among others; pressure vessels, piping systems and controls. Qualified personnel carry out maintenance operations with previous training in maintenance practices. Furthermore, these personnel are offered specialized training as needed. Any equipment deficiencies identified by the maintenance checks are corrected in a safe and timely manner.



3.6. Compliance Audits

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Pla

nt conducts audits on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions set out under the RMP rule are being implemented. These audits are carried out at least every three years and any corrective actions required as a result of the audits are undertaken in a safe and prompt manner.



3.7. Incident Investigation

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant promptly investigates any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in a catastrophic release of a regulated substance. These investigations are undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent the release from reoccurring. All reports are retained for a minimum of five years.



4. Five-year Accident History

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant has had an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last five years. There has been no accidental release during this period.



5. Emergency Response Program

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant carries a written emergency response plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The plan includes an emergency evacuation plan and emergency contact numbers. The Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant is included in the Hale County LEPC. The Plainview Fire Department will respond to accidental releases of hazardous materials.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Jack Skaggs Plainview Municipal Water Treatment Plant does not anticipate any changes to the facility.
